did.unittitle: Margarethe and Berthold Stern liner ephemera

bioghist.p: Margarethe (b.1908) and Bertold Stern (b.1900) were married in 1930 in Germany. For their honeymoon, they sailed on the Norddeutscher Breman. In 1933, they immigrated to the United States. They became citizens in 1939. Margarethe's father, Louis Liebmann (b.1873), immigrated to the US and applied fro U.S. citizenship in 1937. Berthold Stern was an allergist and a Captain in the US Army. He was on active duty from 1943 to 1946 and from 1946 to 1953 he was in the officers reserve corps.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of personal papers, photographs, and ephemera of Margarethe and Berthold Stern and Margarethe's father, sister, and brother Louis, Lore, and Fritz Liebmann. Personal papers include: passports and immigration forms and naturalization certificates for Louis, Margarethe, and Lore Liebmann; divorce papers for Lore Leibmann Serlin; identity card of Fritz Liebmann; certificates of appreciation to Berthold Stern for his work for the Selective Service, 1940s; and US Army service records for Berthold Stern. Other items in the collection include: Margarethe's autograph book, 1927; a scrapbook of Lore Liebmann Serlin's wedding and honeymoon; loose, framed, and mounted family photographs; photo albums, including a photo album from trip to Yugoslavia, undated, and a photo album of a trip on the SS Bremen; photo album of Fritz M. Liebmann with photos and postcards from Germany, England, and the United States; souvenir photographs from Bremen, Darmstadt, Yosemite National Park, New York City, Pike's Peak, and other destinations; and a panoramic photo of Berthold Stern's medical training group (24th officer's training battalion) in Carlisle, PA Liner materials include Hamburg-Amerika Line: traveler's checks, luggage stickers, and a letter. A printed guide to the Western Pacific issued to members of the Army, Navy, and Marine Corps
